result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: State's Witness List
Trial Order signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 10/11/22

10/10/22:  Cash bond converted to a signature bond.  Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant still needs to post $150.00.  

Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key with the exception of incidental contact.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

9:44 AM Defendant Justin M Smith in court.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson appeared by video for Justin M Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests the cash bail be reinstated without a SCRAM reporting requirement.
Arguments by the Defense.  
Court grants motion.  
Court orders signature bond be converted to a cash bond in the amount of $150.00.  Court will remove the condition for SCRAM reporting.  All other conditions to remain as previously set.
Court will set this matter for jury trial.  
Jury trial expected to last 1 day.  Court will select an alternate juror. Each side will receive 4 strikes.  Clerk to prepare a trial order.
Jury status hearing scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on January 10, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on January 5, 2023 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on June 24, 2022 (BC)

Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency filed by Justim Smith.   **Reviewed by Judge Bohren on June 24, 2022 - APPROVED - $100 per month - payments begin on 7-15-22 and then on the 15th day of each month thereafter.** ss
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Hearing on August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key with the exception of incidental contact.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant is to report to WCS within one business day.

10:05 AM Defendant Justin M Smith in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The defendant is provided with a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
